medical_history.chief_complaint: Intermittent right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain for weeks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until two weeks prior to admission when she woke up in the middle of the night with a moderate, nonradiating dull pain in her RUQ which subsided after a few hours. Since then, she has had periodic episodes of RUQ pain, especially at night, which is palliated by sitting up and worsened by laying supine. Two days prior to admission, her RUQ pain intensified, often reaching severe intensity in waves.
